content:
Happy to help!

It's great that you're eager to get back on track (pun intended!). Finding local tracks with HPDE events can be a bit of a challenge, but I've got some resources to help you out:

**Online Track Finders:**

1. **TrackHQ**: A comprehensive directory of tracks in the US and Canada. You can filter by state, track type, and event type (including HPDE). [TrackHQ Website](https://www.trackhq.com/)
2. **NASA (National Auto Sport Association)**: NASA offers HPDE events across the US, and their website allows you to search for tracks and events by region. [NASA Website](https://www.nasaproracing.com/)
3. **SCCA (Sports Car Club of America)**: The SCCA is another well-established organization that offers HPDE events nationwide. You can search for tracks and events on their website. [SCCA Website](https://www.scca.com/)
4. **TrackDays**: A website that lists track days and HPDE events across the US. You can filter by state, track, and event type. [TrackDays Website](https://www.trackdays.com/)

**Local Car Clubs and Organizations:**

1. **Local SCCA Chapters**: Reach out to your local SCCA chapter to ask about HPDE events and tracks in your area. [SCCA Chapter Finder](https://www.scca.com/about/regions)
2. **NASA Regions**: NASA has regional chapters that organize HPDE events. Find your local region and contact them for information on upcoming events. [NASA Region Finder](https://www.nasaproracing.com/about/regions)
3. **BMW CCA (Car Club of America) Chapters**: If you have a BMW, or even if you don't, the BMW CCA often hosts HPDE events at various tracks. Find your local chapter and ask about upcoming events. [BMW CCA Chapter Finder](https://www.bmwcca.org/chapters)
4. **Porsche Club of America (PCA) Regions**: Similar to the BMW CCA, the PCA hosts HPDE events at various tracks. Find your local region and ask about upcoming events. [PCA Region Finder](https://www.pca.org/regions)

**Social Media and Online Forums:**

1. **Facebook Groups**: Join local car enthusiast groups or track-specific groups to ask about HPDE events and get recommendations from fellow enthusiasts.
2. **Reddit (r/trackday)**: A community-driven subreddit for track enthusiasts. You can ask about local tracks and HPDE events in your area.
3. **Local Car Forums**: Look for online forums dedicated to your car's make or model, and ask about HPDE events and track recommendations.

Remember to always research the track, the event organizer, and the safety record before signing up for an HPDE event.

Good luck, and I hope you find some exciting track opportunities near you!
